org.jtrim2.swing.component

Class DrawingConnector<ResultType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim2.swing.component.DrawingConnector<ResultType>
  • Type Parameters:
    ResultType - the type of the object which might be attached to a rendered BufferedImage

    public class DrawingConnector<ResultType>
extends java.lang.Object
    A helper class for triple buffering when rendering to a BufferedImage.

    This class might be useful in the following scenario: Assume that there is a thread doing the actual rendering and it is rendering to a BufferedImage. Once it finished rendering, it needs to publish the result of the rendering some way. It may choose to simply submit the BufferedImage to another thread to display the results and continue the subsequent rendering task. However, to start the another rendering it will need another BufferedImage to render to. If it creates a new BufferedImage, it might cause a heavy load on the garbage collector (since BufferedImage objects are heavy).

    This class helps in the above mentioned scenario when the thread displaying the image can cooperate with the thread doing the rendering. That is, this class is intended to be used the following way:

    1. Once the renderer needs a BufferedImage to render to, it needs to call the getDrawingSurface method to retrieve a BufferedImage.
    2. After rendering completes, the renderer thread must call the presentNewImage method to publish the result of the rendering and then notify in some way the displaying thread that a new rendering result is available. Then, the rendering thread may continue rendering again.
    3. Once the displaying thread knows that a new rendering process has completed, it needs to call the copyMostRecentGraphics method to copy the result of the rendering to a Graphics2D object.
    This class works by storing a reference to two BufferedImage instances, one is the last result presented through the presentNewImage and another one which is used to returned by the getDrawingSurface method call. Notice that presentNewImage method calls overwrite each other's result, so after the second invocation the currently stored BufferedImage will be useless for the DrawingConnector. This is the image which will be returned by the getDrawingSurface method.

    This class is allowed to be subclassed for the sole purpose of overriding the scaleToGraphics method to provide a user defined implementation.

    Thread safety

    Instances of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DrawingConnector

        public DrawingConnector(int width,
                        int height)
        Creates a new DrawingConnector with the specified initial width and height of the image to return by the getDrawingSurface method. This can be later overwritten by a setRequiredWidth method call.
        Parameters:
        width - the initial width of the image to return by the getDrawingSurface method. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        height - the initial height of the image to return by the getDrawingSurface method. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified width or height is a negative integer

    • Method Detail

      • setRequiredWidth

        public final void setRequiredWidth(int width,
                                   int height)
        Sets the width and height of the image to be returned by subsequent invocations of the getDrawingSurface method.

        Concurrent invocations of the getDrawingSurface may return this or the previous width and height values but this method call can be considered atomic (i.e., it can be assumed that both width and height are set at the same time).

        Parameters:
        width - the width of the image to be returned by subsequent invocations of the getDrawingSurface method. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        height - the height of the image to be returned by subsequent invocations of the getDrawingSurface method. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified width or height is a negative integer

      • hasImage

        public final boolean hasImage()
        Checks if the presentNewImage has ever been called or not. That is, if this method returns true every subsequent invocations of this method will also return true. Also, if this method returns true, subsequent invocations of the copyMostRecentGraphics method will actually draw image to the passed Graphics2D object.
        Returns:
        true if the presentNewImage has been called at least once, false otherwise

      • scaleToGraphics

        protected void scaleToGraphics(java.awt.Graphics2D destination,
                               int destWidth,
                               int destHeight,
                               java.awt.image.BufferedImage src,
                               ResultType paintResult)
        Called by the copyMostRecentGraphics method to draw the most recently published image to the specified Graphics2D object.

        Subclasses may override this method to provide a user defined behaviour. The default implementation simply draws the source image to the upper left corner of the Graphics2D object without any scaling.

        Synchronization transparency

        This method is called while holding a lock and therefore it should refrain from doing anything not transparent to synchronization. In particular, it must not acquire locks which might be held while calling any of the methods of this DrawingConnector. The intent of this method is simply to scale the image to the provided graphics.
        Parameters:
        destination - the Graphics2D object to which the specified BufferedImage must be drawn to. This argument cannot be null.
        destWidth - the width (in number of pixels) of the destination graphics to draw to. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        destHeight - the height (in number of pixels) of the destination graphics to draw to. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        src - the BufferedImage the image which is to be drawn to the specified graphics object. This argument cannot be null.
        paintResult - the object associated with the passed image (i.e.: was provided to the presentNewImage) method. This argument can be null if the provider of the image may pass null objects.

      • copyMostRecentGraphics

        public final GraphicsCopyResult<ResultType> copyMostRecentGraphics(java.awt.Graphics2D destination,
                                                                   int width,
                                                                   int height)
        Copies the most recent image provided to the presentNewImage method to the specified Graphics2D object. This method is allowed to be called prior calling presentNewImage but it will not draw anything to the provided graphics in this case.

        Note that this method relies on the scaleToGraphics method to actually draw the image to the graphics.

        Parameters:
        destination - the Graphics2D to which the current image is to drawn to. This argument cannot be null.
        width - the width of the specified graphics. Any painting must be done within this limit. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        height - the height of the specified graphics. Any painting must be done within this limit. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        Returns:
        a GraphicsCopyResult object which stores the object associated with the currently drawn image and a boolean which is false if this method could not copy anything to the specified graphics because there was no image provided yet. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified Graphics2D object is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified width or height is a negative integer

      • offerBuffer

        public final boolean offerBuffer(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Offers a BufferedImage which might be returned by the getDrawingSurface method of this DrawingConnector. The caller must promise that the provided image will no longer be accessed by outside code. This method is not required to actually use the passed image, it may discard it as it sees fit.
        Parameters:
        image - the BufferedImage which might be used by this DrawingConnector when it needs to create a new image. This argument can be null, in which case this method will simply return false.
        Returns:
        true if this method accepted the passed image, false if this method discarded the passed image. In case this method returns false, the caller might access this image after this method returns.

      • presentNewImage

        public final void presentNewImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                  ResultType paintResult)
        Specifies the most recent result of the rendering process. Until this method is called again, subsequent calls to the copyMostRecentGraphics method will copy the image passed to this method.
        Parameters:
        image - the BufferedImage which is to be copied by subsequent copyMostRecentGraphics method calls. This argument cannot be null.
        paintResult - an arbitrary object attached to the rendered image. This object will be returned by the copyMostRecentGraphics method when it copies the currently passed image. This argument is allowed to be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified image is null

      • getDrawingSurface

        public final java.awt.image.BufferedImage getDrawingSurface(int bufferType)
        Returns a BufferedImage to render to. The size of the returned image is the size last set by a previous setRequiredWidth method call.

        In case the required width is 0, then the width of the returned image will be 1. Similarly, in case the required height is 0, then the height of the returned image is 1.

        Parameters:
        bufferType - the type of the BufferedImage (i.e., BufferedImage.getType() to be returned by this method. This argument must be a valid type for a BufferedImage (e.g.: BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_ARGB).
        Returns:
        a new BufferedImage with the specified type. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified type is not a valid type for a BufferedImage
